item.title: What’s Better Than Carrot Cake? This Sweet Potato Version.
item.description: Here, this riff on the classic is more than just a clever trick: It’s a testament to the past.

item.title: I Cut Off a Friend Who Was Abusing Her Daughter. What Can I Do for the Child?
Taylor Swift Is Our Biggest Cinematic Universe. But the Magic Is Fading.
item.description: Pop culture is saturated with franchises, and Swift is the master of creating them. But her marketing is beginning to overtake the music.

item.title: What Trump’s War on Sanctuary Cities Is Really About
item.description: A movement born in churches to help vulnerable immigrants has become a constitutional battleground in Chicago and Portland, Ore.

item.title: Lady Gaga Was Always Gothic. Now the World Has Caught Up to Her.
item.description: At a moment when other pop stars are flirting with dark spectacle, Gaga’s “Mayhem” tour shows that she has perfected it.

item.title: Can You Make Use of Your Neighbors’ Trash Cans?
Is It Bad to Buy Into a Gentrified Neighborhood?
item.description: I can finally afford to live in the area I once only dreamed of calling home. But I’m torn.

item.title: The Dessert That Changed My Life
item.description: These unforgettable poached pears set a food writer on her trajectory.

item.title: My Spouse’s Politics Are Bewildering. Do I Have to Warn Our Houseguest?
item.description: I want my guest to be comfortable, and I want to avoid discomfort, too.

item.title: Stavros Halkias Wants a Career. Will His Fans Let Him Have One?
item.description: The comedian is pivoting from online notoriety to mainstream roles. It’s harder than it looks.

item.title: ‘You’re Going to Lose Your Mind’: My Three-Day Retreat in Total Darkness
item.description: The author spent days in a room with no light. Who would he be when he emerged?

item.title: The Villains on Pre-K TV Are Cuddly, Annoying and … Morally Interesting
item.description: Streaming services have brought a glut of animated shows targeted at small children — and an interesting approach to depicting conflict.

item.title: Takeaways From the Times Magazine Story on Testosterone and Sex Drive
item.description: Here’s when and why experts think testosterone should be prescribed to middle-aged women, and how it affects their lives.

item.title: ‘I’m on Fire’: Testosterone Is Giving Women Back Their Sex Drive — and Then Some
item.description: There is no F.D.A.-approved testosterone product for women. Insurance won’t cover it. Many doctors won’t prescribe it. It’s become a cultural phenomenon.
